intro: Leandra adenothrix, commonly known as the white leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
